channel.title: OrbitWaste
channel.description: Web to learn the basics about the Space Junk

item.title: ESA will launch the first satellite to remove space debris in 2025
item.description: ClearSpace-1 is a mission that will test technology to address a threat to Earth observation or communication systems
item.author: El País

item.title: Junk rain: 100 tons of space junk fall on Earth a year
item.description: More than 7,000 tons of satellite junk are flying around the Earth. The first goal is to detect all fragments. The last one: get rid of them
item.author: El País

item.title: A laboratory to transform space junk
item.description: Dutch artist Daan Roosegaarde presents his project to turn the remains of satellites and rockets in orbit around the Earth into sustainable products
item.author: El País

item.title: The Japanese who has the solution to sweep the space
item.description: Nobu Okada will launch satellites into orbit that locate, track and magnetize trash, then enter the atmosphere to immolate themselves with the debris
item.author: El País

item.title: The remains of a Chinese rocket, visible from various points in Spain when crossing the sky
item.description: The material from the CZ-2F device, which burned when re-entering the atmosphere, has been observed from several cities on the Peninsula around 00:30 this Tuesday
item.author: El País
